page.title: 03Knowsly Cross House, Longnor
page.content:
Knowsly Cross House was, I believe, built in the late eighteenth century and was a thatched house in those days.
The house is situated on the road from Longnor to Sheen. The River Dove runs in the valley to one side and the River Manifold just to the other side.
Knowsly Cross was situated in the garden and was restored in the year 1897 by the then owner Mr. Mark Taylor who came from Yorkshire. I believe the cross dates back to the Danish invasion in the ninth century.
There are wide views over the Derbyshire hills to the east and over the Staffordshire Moorlands to the south.
